Key Match Events: The Detroit Tigers staged an improbable comeback win against the Tampa Bay Rays, tying the game in the eighth inning and securing the win in the ninth inning with a 27th save of the season from Jason Foley.
Pre-Game Insights: The Detroit Tigers were eight games under.500 as recently as Aug. 10, but have since made a dramatic turnaround to enter Thursday at 84-74.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit Tigers play-by-play announcer Jason Benetti delivered an instantly iconic call after the game, praising the team's ability to win despite the odds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers have won 30 of their last 39 games, catapulting them up the standings in the process. They are currently tied with the Kansas City Royals for the second AL Wild Card spot, 2.0 games ahead of the Minnesota Twins with three games to go.
Others: The Tigers' magic number is now two, and FanGraphs gives the team a 96.6% chance of reaching the postseason, compared to 0.2% chance they had back on Aug. 10.
